pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:5.1: 18. The second training rule on swinging the arms
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swinging their arms and resting them on supports while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:7.2: “‘I will not swing my arms while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not swing one’s arms;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:8.2: one should sit keeping the arms steady.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:8.3: If a monk, out of disrespect, swings his arms and rests them on a support while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:9.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:10.1: The eighth training rule is finished.
